title: Only the file extensions are checked, not the MIME types as configured

profile.name: Nextcloud
profile.about: Access, share and protect your files, calendars, contacts, communication & more at home and in your enterprise.

vulnerability_information:
The tool is not working as hoped. File access control speaks of MIME types that are blocked or not blocked. In fact, only the file extensions are checked. If a user renames an unauthorized file to an allowed file, he can upload and download it. The MIME type of the current file is insignificant, only the file extension is checked. 

A company administrator prohibits the upload of exe files using file access control and MIME types. One user 
copies his remote access application as a txt file to Nextcloud and downloads it in his professional environment.

A user on github has created a patch that has not yet found its way into the public repository.

## Impact

An attacker could upload malicious files that have been blocked by the administrator.
vulnerability_information_html:
The tool is not working as hoped. File access control speaks of MIME types that are blocked or not blocked. In fact, only the file extensions are checked. If a user renames an unauthorized file to an allowed file, he can upload and download it. The MIME type of the current file is insignificant, only the file extension is checked.

A company administrator prohibits the upload of exe files using file access control and MIME types. One user
copies his remote access application as a txt file to Nextcloud and downloads it in his professional environment.

A user on github has created a patch that has not yet found its way into the public repository.

Impact

An attacker could upload malicious files that have been blocked by the administrator.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.

activities.message:
Could you check the patch uploaded to github? 

For a customer I need the correct function of the file access control. In my opinion it is a security hole because administrators trust that the rules in the file access control are correct. As already written, the control tool does not use the rules, converts MIME types into file extensions. Then only the file extension is checked, which cannot be trusted.

To avoid misunderstandings: I like your software and the open source idea.

activities.message:
Two months ago I told you about problems related to file access control. Unfortunately I haven't received a (satisfactory) answer yet. Please analyse the problem until 04.12.2019, otherwise I will report the problem to the people of heise.de. 

In my opinion it's a serious bug because administrators rely on nextcloud to control the content of files by mime type. But it doesn't, internally the mime types are converted to file extensions. 

An attacker can rename a malicious file with a permitted extension and file access control has been tricked.

I convinced the decision makers in our company to use nextcloud, now there are accusations because we cannot use nextcloud because of the problems mentioned above.

How can I prevent certain file types from being uploaded (based on mime types)?
activities.markdown_message:
Two months ago I told you about problems related to file access control. Unfortunately I haven't received a (satisfactory) answer yet. Please analyse the problem until 04.12.2019, otherwise I will report the problem to the people of heise.de.

In my opinion it's a serious bug because administrators rely on nextcloud to control the content of files by mime type. But it doesn't, internally the mime types are converted to file extensions.

An attacker can rename a malicious file with a permitted extension and file access control has been tricked.

I convinced the decision makers in our company to use nextcloud, now there are accusations because we cannot use nextcloud because of the problems mentioned above.

How can I prevent certain file types from being uploaded (based on mime types)?

activities.message:
Hi @teaport 

we analysed the problem already. We are also looking into a way to solve this without killing the performance completely, because the file is downloaded to the server everytime you try to access it just to check the mimetype (which is a problem for bigger files on object stores).

If we fail to find another solution soon, we will use this approach though.

cheers

PS: threatening with heise.de is not the best way to communicate

activities.message:
Hi @teaport 

In case you want to test the patch as well, see the attachment.
It was developed against master, but should also apply cleanly on Nextcloud 17.

Not sure if you use external storage, but if you do maybe you can give us your opinion on the performance hit.

cheers nickv

activities.message: I have updated Nextcloud to version "17-2019-12-04" via snap. Then I applied the patch. I locked mp3 files with file access control. Uploading didn't work. Also after renaming to a txt-file it didn't work! Great! It seems to work. Of course the hint with heise.de was only due to my frustration. I will not continue this to the public. When could this patch "migrate" to the stable version? I could not test external memory.

activities.message:
It's going to be part of our next minor releases.
Our current schedule has them on 19th december:
https://github.com/nextcloud/server/wiki/Maintenance-and-Release-Schedule

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for your report again. This has been resolved in our latest maintenance releases and we're working on the advisories at the moment.

Please let us know how you'd like to be credited in our official advisory. We require the following information:

- Name / Pseudonym
- Email address (optional)
- Website (optional)
- Company (optional)
